text: Paul, an apostle (not from men, neither through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead),
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the brethren that are with me, unto the churches of Galatia:
speaker: Narrator

text: Grace to you and peace from God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us out of this present evil world, according to the will of our God and Father:
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom be the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I marvel that ye are so quickly removing from him that called you in the grace of Christ unto a different gospel;
speaker: Narrator

text: which is not another gospel: only there are some that trouble you, and would pervert the gospel of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But though we, or an angel from heaven, should preach unto you any gospel other than that which we preached unto you, let him be anathema.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we have said before, so say I now again, If any man preacheth unto you any gospel other than that which ye received, let him be anathema.
speaker: Narrator

text: For am I now seeking the favor of men, or of God? or am I striving to please men? if I were still pleasing men, I should not be a servant of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I make known to you, brethren, as touching the gospel which was preached by me, that it is not after man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For neither did I receive it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye have heard of my manner of life in time past in the Jews’ religion, how that beyond measure I persecuted the church of God, and made havoc of it:
speaker: Narrator

text: and I advanced in the Jews’ religion beyond many of mine own age among my countrymen, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when it was the good pleasure of God, who separated me, even from my mother’s womb, and called me through his grace,
speaker: Narrator

text: to reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the Gentiles; straightway I conferred not with flesh and blood:
speaker: Narrator

text: neither went I up to Jerusalem to them that were apostles before me: but I went away into Arabia; and again I returned unto Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Cephas, and tarried with him fifteen days.
speaker: Narrator

text: But other of the apostles saw I none, save James the Lord’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now touching the things which I write unto you, behold, before God, I lie not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I was still unknown by face unto the churches of Judaea which were in Christ:
speaker: Narrator

text: but they only heard say, He that once persecuted us now preacheth the faith of which he once made havoc;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they glorified God in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after the space of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I went up by revelation; and I laid before them the gospel which I preach among the Gentiles but privately before them who were of repute, lest by any means I should be running, or had run, in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But not even Titus who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised:
speaker: Narrator

text: and that because of the false brethren privily brought in, who came in privily to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage:
speaker: Narrator

text: to whom we gave place in the way of subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from those who were reputed to be somewhat (whatsoever they were, it maketh no matter to me: God accepteth not man’s person)—they, I say, who were of repute imparted nothing to me:
speaker: Narrator

text: but contrariwise, when they saw that I had been intrusted with the gospel of the uncircumcision, even as Peter with the gospel of the circumcision
speaker: Narrator

text: (for he that wrought for Peter unto the apostleship of the circumcision wrought for me also unto the Gentiles);
speaker: Narrator

text: and when they perceived the grace that was given unto me, James and Cephas and John, they who were reputed to be pillars, gave to me and Barnabas the right hands of fellowship, that we should go unto the Gentiles, and they unto the circumcision;
speaker: Narrator

text: only they would that we should remember the poor; which very thing I was also zealous to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I resisted him to the face, because he stood condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: For before that certain came from James, he ate with the Gentiles; but when they came, he drew back and separated himself, fearing them that were of the circumcision.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of the Jews dissembled likewise with him; insomuch that even Barnabas was carried away with their dissimulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when I saw that they walked not uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, I said unto Cephas before them all, If thou, being a Jew, livest as do the Gentiles, and not as do the Jews, how compellest thou the Gentiles to live as do the Jews?
speaker: Narrator

text: We being Jews by nature, and not sinners of the Gentiles,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet knowing that a man is not justified by the works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ, even we believed on Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ, and not by the works of the law: because by the works of the law shall no flesh be justified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if, while we sought to be justified in Christ, we ourselves also were found sinners, is Christ a minister of sin? God forbid.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if I build up again those things which I destroyed, I prove myself a transgressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I through the law died unto the law, that I might live unto God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been crucified with Christ; and it is no longer I that live, but Christ liveth in me: and that life which I now live in the flesh I live in faith, the faith which is in the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself up for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not make void the grace of God: for if righteousness is through the law, then Christ died for nought.
speaker: Narrator

text: O foolish Galatians, who did bewitch you, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was openly set forth crucified?
speaker: Narrator

text: This only would I learn from you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
speaker: Narrator

text: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now perfected in the flesh?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did ye suffer so many things in vain? if it be indeed in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: He therefore that supplieth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, doeth he it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
speaker: Narrator

text: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned unto him for righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Know therefore that they that are of faith, the same are sons of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the gospel beforehand unto Abraham, saying, In thee shall all the nations be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then they that are of faith are blessed with the faithful Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as many as are of the works of the law are under a curse: for it is written, Cursed is every one who continueth not in all things that are written in the book of the law, to do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now that no man is justified by the law before God, is evident: for, The righteous shall live by faith;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the law is not of faith; but, He that doeth them shall live in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us; for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:
speaker: Narrator

text: that upon the Gentiles might come the blessing of Abraham in Christ Jesus; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men: Though it be but a man’s covenant, yet when it hath been confirmed, no one maketh it void, or addeth thereto.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to Abraham were the promises spoken, and to his seed. He saith not, And to seeds, as of many; but as of one, And to thy seed, which is Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this I say: A covenant confirmed beforehand by God, the law, which came four hundred and thirty years after, doth not disannul, so as to make the promise of none effect.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if the inheritance is of the law, it is no more of promise: but God hath granted it to Abraham by promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: What then is the law? It was added because of transgressions, till the seed should come to whom the promise hath been made; and it was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a mediator is not a mediator of one; but God is one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid: for if there had been a law given which could make alive, verily righteousness would have been of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the scripture shut up all things under sin, that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to them that believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: But before faith came, we were kept in ward under the law, shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that the law is become our tutor to bring us unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now that faith is come, we are no longer under a tutor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye are all sons of God, through faith, in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: For as many of you as were baptized into Christ did put on Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: There can be neither Jew nor Greek, there can be neither bond nor free, there can be no male and female; for ye all are one man in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if ye are Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed, heirs according to promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say that so long as the heir is a child, he differeth nothing from a bondservant though he is lord of all;
speaker: Narrator

text: but is under guardians and stewards until the day appointed of the father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we also, when we were children, were held in bondage under the rudiments of the world:
speaker: Narrator

text: but when the fulness of the time came, God sent forth his Son, born of a woman, born under the law,
speaker: Narrator

text: that he might redeem them that were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because ye are sons, God sent forth the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, crying, Abba, Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So that thou art no longer a bondservant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir through God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit at that time, not knowing God, ye were in bondage to them that by nature are no gods:
speaker: Narrator

text: but now that ye have come to know God, or rather to be known by God, how turn ye back again to the weak and beggarly rudiments, whereunto ye desire to be in bondage over again?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye observe days, and months, and seasons, and years.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am afraid of you, lest by any means I have bestowed labor upon you in vain.
speaker: Narrator

text: I beseech you, brethren, become as I am, for I also am become as ye are. Ye did me no wrong:
speaker: Narrator

text: but ye know that because of an infirmity of the flesh I preached the gospel unto you the first time:
speaker: Narrator

text: and that which was a temptation to you in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected; but ye received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where then is that gratulation of yourselves? for I bear you witness, that, if possible, ye would have plucked out your eyes and given them to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then am I become your enemy, by telling you the truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: They zealously seek you in no good way; nay, they desire to shut you out, that ye may seek them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is good to be zealously sought in a good matter at all times, and not only when I am present with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: My little children, of whom I am again in travail until Christ be formed in you—
speaker: Narrator

text: but I could wish to be present with you now, and to change my tone; for I am perplexed about you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell me, ye that desire to be under the law, do ye not hear the law?
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written, that Abraham had two sons, one by the handmaid, and one by the freewoman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit the son by the handmaid is born after the flesh; but the son by the freewoman is born through promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which things contain an allegory: for these women are two covenants; one from mount Sinai, bearing children unto bondage, which is Hagar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this Hagar is mount Sinai in Arabia and answereth to the Jerusalem that now is: for she is in bondage with her children.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jerusalem that is above is free, which is our mother.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For it is written,
Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not;
Break forth and cry, thou that travailest not:
For more are the children of the desolate than of her that hath the husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we, brethren, as Isaac was, are children of promise.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as then he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the Spirit, so also it is now.
speaker: Narrator

text: Howbeit what saith the scripture? Cast out the handmaid and her son: for the son of the handmaid shall not inherit with the son of the freewoman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore, brethren, we are not children of a handmaid, but of the freewoman.
speaker: Narrator

text: For freedom did Christ set us free: stand fast therefore, and be not entangled again in a yoke of bondage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I Paul say unto you, that, if ye receive circumcision, Christ will profit you nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, I testify again to every man that receiveth circumcision, that he is a debtor to do the whole law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye are severed from Christ, ye who would be justified by the law; ye are fallen away from grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we through the Spirit by faith wait for the hope of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth anything, nor uncircumcision; but faith working through love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye were running well; who hindered you that ye should not obey the truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: This persuasion came not of him that calleth you.
speaker: Narrator

text: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have confidence to you-ward in the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I, brethren, if I still preach circumcision, why am I still persecuted? then hath the stumbling-block of the cross been done away.
speaker: Narrator

text: I would that they that unsettle you would even go beyond circumcision.
speaker: Narrator

text: For ye, brethren, were called for freedom; only use not your freedom for an occasion to the flesh, but through love be servants one to another.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the whole law is fulfilled in one word, even in this: Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say, Walk by the Spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the lust of the flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh; for these are contrary the one to the other; that ye may not do the things that ye would.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if ye are led by the Spirit, ye are not under the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are these: fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: idolatry, sorcery, enmities, strife, jealousies, wraths, factions, divisions, parties,
speaker: Narrator

text: envyings, drunkenness, revellings, and such like; of which I forewarn you, even as I did forewarn you, that they who practise such things shall not inherit the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
speaker: Narrator

text: meekness, self-control; against such there is no law.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they that are of Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with the passions and the lusts thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we live by the Spirit, by the Spirit let us also walk.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us not become vainglorious, provoking one another, envying one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brethren, even if a man be overtaken in any trespass, ye who are spiritual, restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness; looking to thyself, lest thou also be tempted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bear ye one another’s burdens, and so fulfil the law of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if a man thinketh himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let each man prove his own work, and then shall he have his glorying in regard of himself alone, and not of his neighbor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For each man shall bear his own burden.
speaker: Narrator

text: But let him that is taught in the word communicate unto him that teacheth in all good things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not deceived; God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man soweth, that shall he also reap.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he that soweth unto his own flesh shall of the flesh reap corruption; but he that soweth unto the Spirit shall of the Spirit reap eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let us not be weary in well-doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, as we have opportunity, let us work that which is good toward all men, and especially toward them that are of the household of the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: See with how large letters I write unto you with mine own hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: As many as desire to make a fair show in the flesh, they compel you to be circumcised; only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For not even they who receive circumcision do themselves keep the law; but they desire to have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But far be it from me to glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world hath been crucified unto me, and I unto the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: For neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creature.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as many as shall walk by this rule, peace be upon them, and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Henceforth let no man trouble me; for I bear branded on my body the marks of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brethren. Amen.
speaker: Narrator
